comments:
Happened once, after a normal Eclipse shutdown, and machine reboot (WinXP); the PDE perspective had the Package Expl. open, tiled atop the Outline and the Hierarchy Views; one java-file was selected and open. Here's the call-stack: 

!SESSION 2006-03-06 09:36:32.985 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M20050929-0840
java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -Xmx512M
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -Xmx512M

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.workbench 4 0 2006-03-06 09:37:01.606
!MESSAGE Unable to create view ID org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer: Argument not valid
!STACK 0

This is quite an old build, lots has changed in the tree viewer (TreeSelection). I suggest to close this one, and see if we get something similar with the latest code.
